result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian R. Weaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of the action.  60 days to pay.
Good time and Huber privileges granted.  60 days to report if also ordered in sentencing after revocation file.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adrian R. Weaver in court with attorney Steven G Richards.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to simple Possession of THC charge. Court reviews max. penalties, elements.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Defendant agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Status conference on May 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Adrian R. Weaver in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Defendant Adrian R. Weaver in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case to be taken up later today if revocation packet arrives in 12-CM-214.
Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Adrian R. Weaver in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Adrian R. Weaver in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defense before hearing. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Adrian R. Weaver appeared by video conference.  Attorney Eric S. Maciolek appeared by phone.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/31/14, 10:00.
